element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm computes the directional mean of a set of lines in a vector layer. Each segment of the input lines is treated as a vector. Summing up all those vector, a new one showing the directional mean is obtained. This vector is represented as a single-segment line in the resulting vector layer
The modulus of the resulting vector provides information about the directional variance. Uniform directions will yield longer vectors.

image.description: Directional mean (red line) of the channel network (blue lines)

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The vector layer with the directional mean vector. Its attributes table contains the following fields: * mean distance * angle (azimuth) * circular variance.
